result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie J. Howen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessie J Howen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF372, 13CF390, 14CF34, 14CF35, 14CF155, 14CF287, 14CF426, 14CM165
11:06 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Court questions Atty Drengler re: competency of client. 
Atty Drengler believes his client is still competent at this time. 

Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 Parties stipulate to the evaluation by Dr. Baker.  Proposes the Court enter those pleas as NGI and place the defendant on supervision.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF372 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST while maintaining NGI. 
14CF34 Count 1 - NO CONTEST while maintaining NGI.
14CF287 Count 1 - NO CONTEST while maintaining NGI.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court does not enter the conviction as parties have stipulated to the reports of Dr. Baker.  Court reads the opinion of Dr. Baker
Both counsel agree to the stipulation. 

BY THE COURT:  
Court further finds the defendant Not Guilty by Reason of Mental disease or defect in 13CF372 Counts 1 & 2, 14CF34 Count 1 and 14CF287 Count 1.  

Court questions parties re: maximum penalties. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements.  Believe the maximum penalties would be 30 years. 
Atty Drengler makes statements.  Asks court to amend the Order he had prepared. 
Court amends the maximums on the Order. 
Atty Knaapen suggests an 8 year period of commitment in 13CF372 and 6 years on each of the bail jumpings (14CF34 & 14CF287) to run concurrent. 
Atty Drengler makes statements to the Court.  The victim is present and would like to address the court prior.  Makes additional arguments to the Court. 
Victim makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the victim. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions sentence credit. 
Atty Drengler indicates there are 7 days credit total. 
Court will not put the credit on the order yet but will add the credit later to ensure there is the correct amount. 
Court questions if parties agree to the orders running concurrently.
Parties agree to concurrent orders. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court enters an Order that the defendant be committed to DHS in 13CF372 for a period of 8 years and in 14CF34 & 14CF287 for 6 years, running concurrent.
The days of credit will be added after they are determined. 
Court orders a Pre-Disposition Investigation.  
The Court orders DHS to conduct the PDI and prepare a report to assist the court in framing a placement order under the commitment.  
All the defendant's treatment records requested by the investigator be released to the investigator.  
Report to be furnished no later than 8/11/2015.
All other counts and files are dismissed and read-in pursuant to the plea agreement. 

Atty Drengler to prepare the further orders needed at the final hearing.

Defendant Jessie J Howen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler and Atty John H Wallace. David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has numberous cases as listed 13CF372, 13CF390, 14CF34, 14CF35, 14CF155, 14CF155, 14CF287, 14CF426 and 14CM165.
The only case heard today was 14CF426.

10:13 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Atty Wallace appears on case 14CF426; he will appear on this and Atty Drengler to take over for all other cases.
Atty Knaapen makes statements on the record and they will be waiving the preliminary hearing on 14CF426.
Atty Knaapen states that there is a plea agreement and would like to have this set on a separate date.
Court makes statements regarding the cases included in this hearing today.
Court addresses Atty Drengler regarding the competency of his client; Atty Drengler answers questions on the record.
Atty Drengler indicates that the defendant Jessie Howen is competent to proceed today but is confused as to why this hearing is being held.
Atty Wallace makes a statement.
Court has been handed a copy of the information.
Atty Drengler makes a statement as to why Atty Wallace had been appointed on only one case; Atty Drengler explains on the record.
Defendant is still residing in Door County.
Defendants mother is in the courtroom today and is questioned by the Court.
Court questions the Defendant regarding his participation in the Pre-Trial Supervision Program.
Court makes statements to the Defendant and bailjumping on his behalf.

**WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING on 14CF426:
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Information has been filed.

**ARRAIGNMENT on 14CF426:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered due to mental disease or defect; Atty's stipulate to the NGI.
Bond Continued.

BY THE COURT:
Atty Wallace is allowed to withdraw as counsel for the defendant as Atty Drengler will now be the Atty of record.
Counsel to schedule next court date with Branch 3 JA.
Pre-disposition Investigation to be completed.
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

and Motion for Discovery.
Request for Documents and Motion for Discovery
Pre-trial conference on January 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jessie J Howen in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF372, 13CF390, 14CF34, 14CF35, 14CF155, 14CF287, 14CF426, 14CM165

9:44 a.m.  Court calls the case.  
Court reviews the files.  Summarizes the discussion between the parties in chamber. 
Matter will be set for a pre-trial.  If parties are prepared to proceed on 1/26, then the Court will do or another date will be set. 
Court notes there was a report by PTSP.  Court did enter an order that he no longer have to participate that. 
Clerk notes a copy of the minutes from the 10/13 hearing were sent to PTSP. 
Atty Knaapen states he will contact day report and advise them of the change.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on December 19, 2014 at 09:30 am.
$2,000 sig bond:  Comply with conditions of all outstanding bonds.

Defendant Jessie J. Howen in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived for preliminary.
BTC: $2,000 sig bond:  Comply with conditions of all outstanding bonds.  Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 09:30 am.
